title: Picture Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of famous sights, symbols, and objects!

questions.question: Which famous landmark features a large copper statue of a robed woman holding a torch?
questions.explanation: The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France, dedicated in 1886.

questions.question: Which building has a large glass pyramid in front of it?
questions.explanation: The glass pyramid at the Louvre in Paris was designed by architect I.M. Pei and opened in 1989.

questions.question: Which famous painting shows a woman with a mysterious smile and no eyebrows?
questions.explanation: The Mona Lisa was painted by Leonardo da Vinci and hangs in the Louvre Museum in Paris.

questions.question: Which country's flag features a red maple leaf on a white background with red bars on each side?
questions.explanation: The Canadian flag, known as the Maple Leaf, was adopted in 1965.

questions.question: Which landmark is a massive ancient amphitheater in Rome with arched openings?
questions.explanation: The Colosseum in Rome could hold up to 80,000 spectators and was completed in 80 AD.

questions.question: Which famous structure is a tall iron lattice tower located on the Champ de Mars in Paris?
questions.explanation: The Eiffel Tower was built by Gustave Eiffel for the 1889 World's Fair.

questions.question: Which painting depicts a swirling night sky with bright stars over a village?
questions.explanation: The Starry Night was painted by Vincent van Gogh in 1889 while at an asylum in France.

questions.question: Which world wonder is a white marble mausoleum located in Agra, India?
questions.explanation: The Taj Mahal was built by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal, completed around 1653.

questions.question: Which country's flag features a circle of gold stars on a blue background?
questions.explanation: The European Union flag features 12 gold stars in a circle, symbolizing unity and harmony.

questions.question: Which famous clock tower is attached to the Palace of Westminster in London?
questions.explanation: Big Ben is actually the nickname for the Great Bell inside the Elizabeth Tower at the Palace of Westminster.

questions.question: Which painting shows melting clocks draped over a barren landscape?
questions.explanation: The Persistence of Memory was painted by Salvador Dali in 1931, and is one of the most famous surrealist works.

questions.question: Which ancient monument consists of a ring of massive standing stones on Salisbury Plain in England?
questions.explanation: Stonehenge is believed to have been constructed from 3000 BC to 2000 BC.

questions.question: Which famous structure is a large orange-red suspension bridge spanning the Golden Gate strait in California?
questions.explanation: The Golden Gate Bridge was completed in 1937 and its distinctive International Orange color helps it stand out against fog.

questions.question: Which painting by Sandro Botticelli depicts a goddess emerging from the sea on a giant shell?
questions.explanation: The Birth of Venus was painted around 1485 and shows Venus arriving at the shore after her birth from sea foam.

questions.question: Which country's flag is the only national flag that is not rectangular, featuring two stacked triangles?
questions.explanation: Nepal's flag consists of two stacked triangles, making it the only non-rectangular national flag in the world.
